official-title.#text: To establish the Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives May 7, 2014.

text.#text: Members of the
a demonstrated commitment to the research, study, or promotion of women's history, art, political or economic status, or culture; and
expertise in museum administration;
expertise in fundraising for nonprofit or cultural institutions;
experience in the study and teaching of women’s history;
experience in studying the issue of the representation of women in art, life, history, and culture at the
extensive experience in public or elected service;
experience in the administration of, or the planning for, the establishment of, museums; or
experience in the planning, design, or construction of museum facilities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

text.#text: No employee of the Federal Government may serve as a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be appointed not later than the date that is 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act.

Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report containing the recommendations of the
with respect to a plan of action for the establishment and maintenance of a National Women’s History Museum in Washington, DC.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that addresses the following issues:

text.#text: The
The availability and cost of collections to be acquired and housed in the Museum.
The impact of the Museum on regional women history-related museums.
Potential locations for the Museum in Washington, DC, and its environs.
Whether the Museum should be part of the
The governance and organizational structure from which the Museum should operate.
Best practices for engaging women in the development and design of the Museum.
The cost of constructing, operating, and maintaining the Museum.
